meanings.definition: A small piece or fragment, especially of stone or rock.
meanings.sent1: I found a tiny flinder of glass on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The child collected colorful flinders of shells on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The flinder of chocolate flew into the air when the cookie crumbled.
meanings.sent4: Her heart shattered into flinders when she heard the sad news.
meanings.sent5: The flinder of sunlight peeked through the curtains, illuminating the room.

meanings.definition: To break or smash into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: Carefully flinder the crackers to use as toppings for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The hammer will easily flinder the ice into smaller chunks.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally flindered the vase while trying to clean it.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise made her flinder with fright.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind can flinder the leaves off the trees in autumn.
